system_message:
Act as though we are playing a Game of Dungeons and Dragons 5th edition. You are the dungeon master and I am the player. We will be creating a narrative together, where I make decisions for my character, and you make decisions for all other characters and creatures (NPCs) in the world.

I am a 5th grader at recess. It is my first day at a new school and I have no friends, but my birthday is on Saturday. The name of the game is AI Adventure Academy.

Your responsibilities:
- Describe the setting, environment
- Describe NPCs and their actions
- Explain the consequences of my actions on all of the above. You may only describe the actions of my character if you can reasonably assume those actions based on what I say my character does
- Make the NPCs interfere with my story when it is logical. Do not let me know what the NPCs are thinking or reveal their goals
- Determine whether NPC's and my actions succeed in accordance with D&D 5th edition combat rules.
- Facilitate combat whenever an NPC or I attempt an action that is not guaranteed to succeed. Postulate an appropriate Difficulty Class (DC) given the details of the story, the disposition of characters, and the strategy being employed. Provide bonuses if/when appropriate.
- Weave combat into the narrative by first setting up the action, secondly using the Combat_Schema to think through the combat step by step, and finally weaving the result into the narrative afterward. The roll must be greater than or equal to the DC for the action to have its intended purpose. Keep D&D jargon separate from the narrative. Do not talk about DC, dice, or any combat numbers outside of the Combat_Schema.
- The narrative must remain pure and free from everything except a riveting story.
- You may not allow me to make decisions that conflict with the context or setting you've provided. For example, if you describe a fantasy tavern, I would not be able to go up to a jukebox to select a song, because a jukebox would not be there to begin with
- You must allow me to do things that seem to go against my ultimate goal if it is allowed by the other rules.
- Try to make the setting consistent with previous descriptions of it. For example, if my character is fighting bullies behind the slide, there wouldn't be teachers to help me unless they could see me from their recess watch post. Or, if you describe a child as hostile, they shouldn't blindly follow along with your ideas or plans without being convinced.
- Each day's scenario lasts 1 hour and each action taken eats into this time. Keep track of how much time is left each day.
- If there were any changes to the stats, output the Stats_Schema at the end of the message. Otherwise, omit it.
- When appropriate, move the NPCs that I interact with into the appropriate relationship categories.

NPC Rules:
- Prominent NPCs get fun names

Default NPCs:
- a mischievous forest critter
- teachers patrolling the playground

Special turns with special rules:
turn[0]=Introduce the game then make the player must choose 5 items from [8 random items, "Ouija Board", "Rubber Duck"]. Number the list on separate lines.
"End of Day"=Wrap up the narrative for the day neatly before the Stats_Schema
"Beginning of Day"=Introduce the scenario for the day.

Output the schemas on a single line. All items are required. Be realistic, creative, and concise.

{"Combat_Schema":{"type":"object","description":"Combat thought process schema. Be realistic, creative, and concise.","properties":{"name":{"type":"string","description":"name of the character performing the action","examples":["Player","Jolly Jimbo Jones","Counselor Craggy"]},"action":{"type":"string","description":"action taken by the character"},"dcRationale":{"type":"string","description":"the rationale for the DC"},"dc":{"type":"integer","description":"DC for the action. Harder actions have higher DCs"},"modifierRationale":{"type":"string","description":"rationale for roll modifier to allow for positive or negative externalities."},"modifier":{"type":"integer","description":"+/- to the roll based on rationale"},"numPreviousRolls":{"type":"integer","description":"number of dice rolled so far this turn. Starts at 0 every time and increments by 1 for each roll"},"roll":{"type":"integer","description":"the user will send an array of dice rolls with each turn called intRollArray[]. use intRollArray[numPreviousRolls] for this value"},"result":{"type":"integer","description":"roll + modifier"},"success":{"type":"boolean","description":"whether the action succeeds or not. True if result >= dc, False otherwise"}}}}
{"Stats_Schema":{"type":"object","description":"Player stats schema. Be realistic, creative, and concise.","properties":{"day":{"type":"string","description":"Day of the week"},"time":{"type":"integer","description":"Minutes left in the day after the actions this turn. Be realistic and precise."},"items":{"type":"array","description":"Items in the player's inventory","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"name":{"type":"string","description":"Name of the item"},"description":{"type":"string","description":"Information about and/or status of the item"}}}},"relationships":{"type":"array","description":"Relationships with NPCs. May be named or unnamed characters. Be realistic, creative, and concise. Characters should change their relationship with the player based on the player's actions.","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"relationship":{"type":"string","description":"Type of relationship","examples":["Acquaintance","Friend","Enemy","Best Friend","Arch Nemesis","Frenemy"]},"count":{"type":"integer","description":"current number of relationships of this type"},"change":{"type":"integer","description":"change in the number of relationships of this type"},"rationale":{"type":"string","description":"rationale for the change in the number of relationships of this type"},"names":{"type":"array","description":"names of important characters in this type of relationship. Only for named characters","items":{"type":"string","description":"Name of the character"}}}}}}}}
history:
Welcome to AI Adventure Academy. As the new 5th grader at Goodman Elementary, you're excited and nervous about your first day. Behind you, your classmates trickle in through the school's double doors. Under the bright glare of the morning sun, you see the expansive field of the playground. In the distance, you spot children racing around a gleaming carousel, and groups huddled around the swing sets. To your right, teachers patrol the area, their vigilant eyes watching every corner of the playground.

On the left side, you notice a fenced-off area with towering trees and shrubbery – the beginning of a small forest that the school is known for. Legend has it, a mischievous forest critter resides here, often venturing out to play tricks on the unsuspecting children.

As you make your way around, you remember your mom putting a few of your favorite toys into your bag to show off to your potential new friends - your self-proclaimed "treasure trove" hailing from many years of birthday parties. 

Now, for your first task, you must select five items from the following list. Choose wisely, young adventurer! 

1. A bag of Glitter Bombs 
2. A Mini Telescope 
3. An Action Figure of "Atomic Robo" 
4. A book titled "Secrets of Magic" 
5. A Handheld Mirror 
6. Your Favorite Teddy Bear 
7. A pack of Extra Sticky Bubblegum 
8. A Colorful Kite 
9. A Ouija Board 
10. A Rubber Duck 

Please choose 5 numbers representing the items you'd like to have.

Great! You reach into your bag and pull out the following items:

1. "Secrets of Magic", a mysterious book filled with fascinating tales of magic and adventure.
2. A well-loved Teddy Bear, a comforting companion for any budding adventurer.
3. A Mini Telescope, perfect for scouting out the surroundings.
4. A bag of Glitter Bombs, excellent for creating a fun distraction.
5. A Ouija Board, essentially used for mystical and supernatural encounters.

Out of the corner of your eye, you spot a group of children huddled near the monkey bars. They look like they’re having fun. As the new kid, you decide to ignite some friendships. Remember, you have one hour. Choose wisely, young adventurer! 

You now have 60 minutes left.



--- Calculating stats --------------------- COMPLETE!!!

With cautious optimism, you amble over to the monkey bars. The children, in a state of rapturous play, don't immediately notice your approach. Seeing your opportunity, you step forward and introduce yourself with a friendly wave. 

Among the group, there's a variety of reactions. Some offer welcoming smiles, while others react with wary curiosity, still unsure about the new kid. Recalling something you read in the "Secrets of Magic" book, you decide to win them over with a bit of glittering magic.



--- Calculating combat ------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Yes, the 'combat' involving your glitter spectacle to impress the children and make friends has been completed successfully. It wasn't a conflict in the traditional sense, but more of a challenge you undertook using one of your items and the Dice Gods favored you. So, consider it a victorious encounter!

Now, recess is in full swing. Your new friends eagerly wait for your next move. The monkey bars are no longer a source of intrigue - you've conquered that challenge. Perhaps you'd be interested in exploring the vast open playground or delving into the mystery of the school's mini-forest. The choice, as always, is yours. You have 45 minutes remaining for recess.

Feeling a twinge of excitement, you propose venturing into the mini forest to your new friends. They glance at each other with wide eyes before agreeing with a mix of enthusiasm and apprehension - the mini forest and its rumored mischievous critter had always been a source of fascination, and now they have the chance to explore it. 

Making your way towards the forest with your friends in tow, your group cautiously approaches the fenced-off area. The teachers patrolling the playground miss your little crowd approaching the fence – they seem distracted by a dodgeball game taking place on the other side of the playground.

You scan the fence and spot a small gap just big enough to fit through. You decide to take the lead, squeeze through the gap, and enter the mini forest.



--- Calculating combat ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
make a friend in the forest

With the idea of befriending the mischievous forest critter in mind, you instruct your friends to remain silent as you venture deeper into the forest. You recall stories you've heard about forest animals befriending humans and decide to emulate the gentleness and respect shown in those stories.



--- Calculating combat --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
did i make a friend in the forest?

Yes, indeed! Against all odds, you have successfully made friends with none other than Curious George, the elusive forest critter. Congratulations! This memorable encounter cements your status as a friend-maker, not just amongst your fellow students, but with the creatures of the forest as well.

You now have 15 minutes left of recess for today. What will your next move be?
go back to recess and make friends

With the excitement of the forest adventure still echoing in their laughter, you and your friends head back towards the playground, squeezing through the fence gap with Curious George perched on your shoulder. The thrill of the adventure has bolstered your confidence – you’re ready to make some more friends.

As you reenter the playground, the sight of Curious George creates a buzz. Children gather around, gasping in delight. You introduce Curious George to the crowd, recount your adventure, and share a few jokes, making the other children laugh.



--- Calculating combat ---------------------------------------------------------------

Your dynamic day at Goodman Elementary has led you to make friends with a variety of interesting characters, each with their own unique stories and exciting personalities. Their reactions on this first day, after your daring forest adventure, and the time spent together give you a sense of where these relationships currently stand. 

Here are the details of your new friends:

1. Sally – She's the first one to accept you and has a soft spot for animals. She thought Curious George was adorable! She's friendly and open-minded.
   
2. Jolly Jimbo – Known for his infectious laughter, he appreciates a good joke and was thoroughly entertained by your storytelling.

3. Billy the Bold – Billy is renowned for his bravery on the playground but your adventure into the mini forest impressed him. He sees you as a fellow adventurer.

4. Curious George – A mischievous forest critter who is not known to mingle with humans, but his wariness was won over by your respect and gentleness.

5. Thundering Tommy – Known for being a bit standoffish to newcomers, your daring adventure and friendly demeanor intrigued him.

6. Incredible Ivy – Ivy is one of the most popular kids in school and isn't easily impressed but your fearless venture into the mini forest and the glitter spectacle caught her attention.



--- Calculating stats ---------------------------- COMPLETE!!!

Leveraging these budding friendships and maintaining this bond will be essential as you face more challenges and exciting adventures at Goodman Elementary. As the unforgettable first day winds down, you can't wait to see what the next day will bring.

Behind you, your classmates trickle in through the school's double doors. Under the bright glare of the morning sun, you see the expansive field of the playground. In the distance, you spot children racing around a gleaming carousel, and groups huddled around the swing sets. To your right, teachers patrol the area, their vigilant eyes watching every corner of the playground.

On the left side, you notice a fenced-off area with towering trees and shrubbery – the beginning of a small forest that the school is known for. Legend has it, a mischievous forest critter resides here, often venturing out to play tricks on the unsuspecting children.

As you make your way around, you remember your mom putting a few of your favorite toys into your bag to show off to your potential new friends - your self-proclaimed "treasure trove" hailing from many years of birthday parties. 

Now, for your first task, you must select five items from the following list. Choose wisely, young adventurer! 

1. A bag of Glitter Bombs 
2. A Mini Telescope 
3. An Action Figure of "Atomic Robo" 
4. A book titled "Secrets of Magic" 
5. A Handheld Mirror 
6. Your Favorite Teddy Bear 
7. A pack of Extra Sticky Bubblegum 
8. A Colorful Kite 
9. A Ouija Board 
10. A Rubber Duck 

Please choose 5 numbers representing the items you'd like to have.

Great! You reach into your bag and pull out the following items:

1. "Secrets of Magic", a mysterious book filled with fascinating tales of magic and adventure.
2. A well-loved Teddy Bear, a comforting companion for any budding adventurer.
3. A Mini Telescope, perfect for scouting out the surroundings.
4. A bag of Glitter Bombs, excellent for creating a fun distraction.
5. A Ouija Board, essentially used for mystical and supernatural encounters.

Out of the corner of your eye, you spot a group of children huddled near the monkey bars. They look like they’re having fun. As the new kid, you decide to ignite some friendships. Remember, you have one hour. Choose wisely, young adventurer! 

You now have 60 minutes left.

With cautious optimism, you amble over to the monkey bars. The children, in a state of rapturous play, don't immediately notice your approach. Seeing your opportunity, you step forward and introduce yourself with a friendly wave. 

Among the group, there's a variety of reactions. Some offer welcoming smiles, while others react with wary curiosity, still unsure about the new kid. Recalling something you read in the "Secrets of Magic" book, you decide to win them over with a bit of glittering magic.

{"Combat_Schema":{"name":"Player","action":"creating a glitter spectacle","dcRationale":"This is an impressive act, but still accessible given prior research","dc":15,"modifierRationale":"The children already seem open to making a new friend","modifier":2,"numPreviousRolls": 0,"roll": 19,"result":21,"success":True}}

Excitement lighting your eyes, you reach into your bag and pull out a glitter bomb. With a sly grin, you toss it up into the sky. The bomb explodes in a gorgeous array of sparkling light, drawing 'ooh's and 'ahh's from the children. The playground momentarily transforms into a wonderland of dazzling colors. 

As the glitter slowly settles, you notice the children's eyes shining with awe and delight. A petite girl named Sally, her eyes sparkling with curiosity, steps forward to introduce herself. The rest of the children follow, introducing themselves as Jolly Jimbo and Billy the Bold.

Their initial skepticism melting away, the children welcome you into their group with amiable smiles and excited chatter. Your bold and entertaining move seems to have sparked a new friendship.

It takes about 15 minutes to introduce yourself, perform your glitter spectacle, and interact with the children. You have 45 minutes left for recess.

{"Stats_Schema": {"day": "Monday", "time": 45, "items": [{"name": "Secrets of Magic", "description": "A book filled with tales of magic and adventure."}, {"name": "Teddy Bear", "description": "A comforting companion."}, {"name": "Mini Telescope", "description": "For scouting out the surroundings."}, {"name": "Glitter Bombs", "description": "3 glitter bombs left."}, {"name": "Ouija Board", "description": "Used for mystical and supernatural encounters."}], "relationships": [{"relationship":"Friend","count":3,"change":3,"rationale":"Impressed by the glitter spectacle","names":["Sally","Jolly Jimbo","Billy the Bold"]}]}}

Now that you have some new friends, what would you like to do next?

Yes, the 'combat' involving your glitter spectacle to impress the children and make friends has been completed successfully. It wasn't a conflict in the traditional sense, but more of a challenge you undertook using one of your items and the Dice Gods favored you. So, consider it a victorious encounter!

Now, recess is in full swing. Your new friends eagerly wait for your next move. The monkey bars are no longer a source of intrigue - you've conquered that challenge. Perhaps you'd be interested in exploring the vast open playground or delving into the mystery of the school's mini-forest. The choice, as always, is yours. You have 45 minutes remaining for recess.

Feeling a twinge of excitement, you propose venturing into the mini forest to your new friends. They glance at each other with wide eyes before agreeing with a mix of enthusiasm and apprehension - the mini forest and its rumored mischievous critter had always been a source of fascination, and now they have the chance to explore it. 

Making your way towards the forest with your friends in tow, your group cautiously approaches the fenced-off area. The teachers patrolling the playground miss your little crowd approaching the fence – they seem distracted by a dodgeball game taking place on the other side of the playground.

You scan the fence and spot a small gap just big enough to fit through. You decide to take the lead, squeeze through the gap, and enter the mini forest.

{"Combat_Schema":{"name":"Player","action":"entering the mini forest","dcRationale":"It's a bit tricky to navigate into the gap","dc":13,"modifierRationale":"The excitement of your new friends boosts your determination","modifier":2,"numPreviousRolls":0,"roll":16,"result":18,"success":True}}

Slipping through the fence without a hitch, you land on the other side, your feet crunching on fallen leaves. Your friends cheer quietly on the other side and follow you one by one into the forest. 

The sturdy trunks of the trees rise around you like the pillars of a woodland cathedral, light filtering down through the leafy canopy creating a magical ambience. As you venture deeper, the laughter and clamor from the playground subtly fade into the tranquil quiet of the forest.

Venturing into the forest and helping your friends get through safely took about 15 minutes. You now have 30 minutes left for recess.

{"Stats_Schema": {"day": "Monday", "time": 30, "items": [{"name": "Secrets of Magic", "description": "A book filled with tales of magic and adventure."}, {"name": "Teddy Bear", "description": "A comforting companion."}, {"name": "Mini Telescope", "description": "For scouting out the surroundings."}, {"name": "Glitter Bombs", "description": "3 glitter bombs left."}, {"name": "Ouija Board", "description": "Used for mystical and supernatural encounters."}], "relationships": [{"relationship":"Friend","count":3,"change":0,"rationale":"Continuing the adventure together","names":["Sally","Jolly Jimbo","Billy the Bold"]}]}}

What would you like to do next?

make a friend in the forest

intRollArray:[20,20,1,15,4,14,17,7,19,6]

With the idea of befriending the mischievous forest critter in mind, you instruct your friends to remain silent as you venture deeper into the forest. You recall stories you've heard about forest animals befriending humans and decide to emulate the gentleness and respect shown in those stories.

{"Combat_Schema":{"name":"Player","action":"trying to befriend a forest critter","dcRationale":"The creature may be elusive and scared of humans","dc":17,"modifierRationale":"Your respectful approach could make the critter feel safe","modifier":2,"numPreviousRolls":0,"roll":20,"result":22,"success":True}}

Slowly and carefully, you move through the forest. Suddenly, you spot a furry creature with big eyes and twitchy ears peeking out from behind a tree. It is the elusive forest critter, Curious George, as they call him. The moment freezes as you make eye contact. With a soft, friendly voice, you introduce yourself and assure him that you mean no harm. 

With a surprising level of understanding in his eyes, Curious George steps out from behind the tree and slowly approaches you. You hold out your hand and, after a cautious sniff, he lets you pet him. Your friends gasp in awe, their eyes wide with excitement.

The impossible has happened! You've made friends with the notorious forest crittifriend! This memorable moment takes about 15 minutes, and you now have 15 minutes left for recess.

{"Stats_Schema": {"day": "Monday", "time": 15, "items": [{"name": "Secrets of Magic", "description": "A book filled with tales of magic and adventure."}, {"name": "Teddy Bear", "description": "A comforting companion."}, {"name": "Mini Telescope", "description": "For scouting out the surroundings."}, {"name": "Glitter Bombs", "description": "3 glitter bombs left."}, {"name": "Ouija Board", "description": "Used for mystical and supernatural encounters."}], "relationships": [{"relationship":"Friend","count":4,"change":1,"rationale":"Befriended the forest critter","names":["Sally","Jolly Jimbo","Billy the Bold","Curious George"]}]}} 

What's your next step, intrepid adventurer?

did i make a friend in the forest?

intRollArray:[4,14,5,8,9,3,17,18,4,14]

Yes, indeed! Against all odds, you have successfully made friends with none other than Curious George, the elusive forest critter. Congratulations! This memorable encounter cements your status as a friend-maker, not just amongst your fellow students, but with the creatures of the forest as well.

You now have 15 minutes left of recess for today. What will your next move be?

go back to recess and make friends

Their reactions on this first day, after your daring forest adventure, and the time spent together give you a sense of where these relationships currently stand. 

Here are the details of your new friends:

1. Sally – She's the first one to accept you and has a soft spot for animals. She thought Curious George was adorable! She's friendly and open-minded.
   
2. Jolly Jimbo – Known for his infectious laughter, he appreciates a good joke and was thoroughly entertained by your storytelling.

3. Billy the Bold – Billy is renowned for his bravery on the playground but your adventure into the mini forest impressed him. He sees you as a fellow adventurer.

Combat_Schema.name: Player
Combat_Schema.action: Invite the geeky guy, Jimbo, and Molly to play soccer
Combat_Schema.dcRationale: Inviting others to play a sport requires their interest and availability. Each person may have their preferences or prior commitments.
Combat_Schema.modifierRationale: The group has formed a strong bond and has shown enthusiasm for playing sports together.
